reviews.review_msg: Fantastic lecturer, and very engaging. Cares deeply about student success, marks appropriately. Weekly readings. Would take again.

Professor Malik is a great professor in all respects. She deeply cares about her students' success and makes sure that everyone is understanding the lecture content. The readings that she assigned in this class were very very very relevant and I feel like they gave me an excellent kick start for my academic career. Definitely recommend this class!

I've had her for three classes (IS101 GA102/202) for a reason! Her GA classes are the most interesting I've taken ever, and the assignments are fairly easy to do because she generally prepares you very well, especially for the (open book) exams. Is always willing to help brainstorm ideas for assignments and gives great feedback. Simply peak

Final exam you were allowed to print your notes out or have your computer with you if it was on airplane mode. only one exam and a few papers. The content in her lectures is laid out a little confusing, making it occasionally hard to follow. She was also my TA and randomly chooses people to participate in tutorials so watch out if you don't like it

Prof. Malik is very passionate about teaching. She made a great effort to keep the class engaged for 3 hours. There is a lot of reading but you can get by without doing all of it. She makes sure everyone can pass. However, the material she gave was politically biased as no conservative papers were given, but this is expected given her background.

This class really made me love my major (int'l studies). Dr Malik's lectures were very engaging and she was good at breaking down concepts. She's a pretty cool person. The readings were usually quite interesting and weren't too heavy. Tutorial participation is a big part of the grade.

Dr. Malik was an extremely kind professor, and you could tell she genuinely cared about her students and wanted them to do well. Lectures can get dry, but she gives multiple breaks. Just attend tutorials and try to participate as much as possible. I did absolutely none of the readings and finished with the easiest A of my life.

Would not recommend the class for an elective. Some of the readings are like 30 pages which is crazy for a first year class. Lectures are sometimes confusing because she adds so much info that isn't talked about in the actual readings. The final is an in-class essay which is quite difficult for a class with so much content.

She assigns a lot of readings, but you can get away with reading the summaries she posts online. Her assignments also have tons of flexibility as to what you can write on, so focus on 2-3 big themes in the course and you'll do fine. GPA booster if you attend all the tutorials and are good at writing.
Final was an in class essay and u had to choose 1 topic from 5. The class was not bad but a lot of readings. 2 written assignments and participation which counts as 20%.

She is a very sweet and kind professor. As for the class, there were only two assignments, one work 20% and the other 25%. Tutorials are mandatory as they count for 20% of the class grade. However i would not recommend the class as the final is a in-class essay worth 35%. The class is so content heavy so having an essay for a final makes no sense

This class was beyond confusing, and beyond difficult. I have NEVER written one of these rate my profs, but I had to for this class as a warning not take IS101. There is WAY to much material each class. No one in this class has an understanding of what is going on.

IS101 with Dr Malik was thoroughly enjoyable. For a 3 hour lecture, Dr Malik was able to read the room well and knew when students were becoming tired, and took breaks/ offered reassurance of breaks during these moments. The material was interesting and eye opening. Make sure you refine your essays and ensure you are answering the essay prompt.

Prof Malik was a great lecturer who made all of the information accessible in lectures and explained difficult concepts. She gave great feedback on our assignments and showed care to her students. Her lectures had a lot of information and were not recorded, so make sure you go. She gives all the readings in canvas, so no textbook is needed.

She's really friendly and nice. Your mark will be based on a few papers but from my experiance if you put in effort, do your readings and don't plagiarize you'll be fine. Overall I would definitely recommend taking this course
I loved this professor a lot! I wish there were more like her in the history department. Be prepared to read to understand the lecture content fully because this will also help your participation.

Very captivating lectures. She always seems to know whenever the class is starting to get bored or fidgety and constantly reminds you that you'll have a break soon. The course material is really interesting, and though there are weekly pre-readings she also posts summaries of them the day before lectures, which tells you everything necessary. 10/10

Dr. Malik is very caring and truly tries to connect with her students and wants them to succeed. Her lectures were quite interesting and she was engaging throughout them all. She was understanding of people not doing readings and did her best to explain difficult concepts. Definitely would recommend taking a class with her!!

Took IS 265 and I can say it was probably the most boring class ive taken in my 4 years at uni. She is very nice and gives only 1 hour of readings per week which is very appreciated but wow ive never dreaded going to a lecture this much. I feel as though her rate my prof ratings are pretty overblown or maybe for her upper division classes

Loved Prof.Malik and her lecs! Very understanding (option to hand things in near end of sem bc covid)+deeply passionate in the topics. I liked how she went over assigned readings in lec making it easier to understand as a 1st yr uni student. Tuts were also my fav! Despite papers marked a bit hard bc of the fac, it was a 10/10 for me overall :)

She is very helpful when you ask questions/go to office hours. Her lectures can draw on for a while but shes very perceptive of the class atmosphere and always gives breaks when the class focus is starting to dwindle. Her feedback on papers is a little confusing/unclear so office hours are very helpful. She also tends to post the readings for us.

She is best prof ive had at SFU. The readings are heavy however, in lectures she would explain the readings in depth and will expand and connect them to many topics that I would never even think about. Her grading is very clear and provides clear feedback that helps a lot. she really cares about her students learning. Very interesing class with her

One of the best profs I've had. She actually took the pandemic into consideration and let us hand assignments in until the end of the semester without any penalty. She makes her lectures very clear and is happy to provide further clarification. She'll make you work for your grade so don't skip any class material. Would highly recommend!

Anushay is an awesome prof and makes every story you study very interesting! She cares so much about every individual student. She is very knowledgable, but she talks pretty fast in lecture videos so you have to really pay attention. No tests in this class, only short and easy essays. If you enjoy world history, you will LOVE this class.

Dr. Anushay Malik is THE BEST professor I have had at SFU. Her lectures and readings are incredibly interesting and well planned, where you learn so much information that she is clearly passionate about. She is knowledgable, kind and caring. I can definitely say you are missing out if you don't take her class (yes, she is that awesome).

I have taken her class twice now and I genuinely enjoyed her classes the second time around. She really does care about her students and is very caring. If you are having a difficult situation and let her know, she is willing to delay your due dates for minor assignments. Her marking is very fair and knows how to give critical reflections.

Professor Malik's lectures were really good and her class discussion activities were very engaging. Her assignments were also fun to do! You should be good as long as you're on top of all of the readings.

Anushay is a really chill prof. She's really passionate about history and she wants students to participate by making it stress free. Her understanding that students are stressed during the pandemic is a really crucial thing as a prof. As a result, she tries to make things as easy as possible so students don't feel overwhelmed. You should take her.

Anushay is an amazing professor and she very accommodating during online classes. A truly caring and passionate professor with interesting lectures. She is also available outside of class and holds extra office hours for any last minute questions before an assignment is due. She is somewhat tough on grading, but is very fair

Anushay Malik is a great prof! Super into the class material, and genuinely wants the students to understand and engage the material. Definitely have to read the material a few times to pick out key themes, but if you pay attention in class, it will help! Would highly recommend taking a class with her

Amazing lecturer! She's very thorough and clear during the lectures. She tends to give a lot of readings, which you have to read otherwise it's really hard to follow the lectures. I'd definitely take another course with her!

Malik is THE BEST history professor I have had during my undergrad. She really wants her students to succeed and gives them all the resources to do so. She is always available outside of class and gives in-depth feedback on all assignments. The only issue I had was that I did not participate enough! Wish all profs were as passionate and helpful!

Miss Malik is a passionate and very knowledgeable prof. But her way of teaching is very "up in the air". For a 400 level course I would have liked more seminar-style learning - less emphasis on lecture; heavy and critical discussion of the reading and theory. Overall a satisfactory course, but it should have been better structured.
She's incredible. Offers time outside of class. Critical thinker and overall brilliant. Really enjoyed her class and is considerate of the students' understanding of the course content.
